column3: Yes, I have a list of tests I wanted to add logging to, but I was not sure that kind of change was desired. I ended up closing my last PR like that (#17535) due to lack of interest. Maybe one PR that adds all the missing logging would be helpful.
Looks like #17535 changed the release notes, refactored the test, and added logging. It seems a bit too much for one pull.
ACK. Looked at the changes on the PR branch. Good additions and :+1:  to no longer refer to travis.
- maybe omit "prefer to"\n\n- s/. E.g./, e.g./

According to [review feedback](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17327#pullrequestreview-310002880), it may be better (and shorter) to use the indicative, e.g. "Create..." rather than "Creating..."

(That comment proposes some good guidelines for your consideration:)
- "test x" rather than "testing x"
- logs can replace docstrings/comment blocks
- no need for trailing '...' ellipses
nit: does this need a closing `)`
Added `)`, and changed commit hash from eeee... to ffff...
